question: Skin over pinna is:
exp: Skin over the pinna is closely adherent to the perichondrium on the lateral surface while it is loosely attached on the medial surface.

question: To visualize tympanic membrane pinna has to be pulled
exp: Outer pa of EAC (Cailage) is directed upwards, backwards and medially. Inner pa of EAC (Bone) is directed downwards, forwards and medially. Therefore, to see the tympanic membrane, the pinna has to be pulled backwards, upwards and laterally (BUL) so as to bring the two pas in alignment.
